place.name: MINWEAR
place.gazetteerText: MINWERE, a parish in Narberth district, Pembroke; on the East Cleddan river, 4½ miles WSW of Narberth, and 5 S of Clarbeston-Road r. station. Post town, Narberth. Acres, 1,957. Real property, £1,035. Pop., 99. Houses, 16. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the p. curacy of Slebech, in the diocese of St. David,s. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
